contextId.information: The word "money" is understood. You can make the full meaning of this statement clear. AT: "you will lend money ... you will not borrow money" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: you will lend ... you will not borrow

contextId.information: The word "person" is understood. AT: "for a person who kills another person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: for the one who kills another

contextId.information: You can make clear the understood information. AT: "you must leave the sheaf so a foreigner, an orphan, or a widow can take it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: it must be for the foreigner, for the fatherless, or for the widow

contextId.information: You can make clear the understood information. AT: "When you shake the branches of your olive tree, causing the olives to fall to the ground so you can pick them up" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: When you shake your olive tree

contextId.information: You can make clear the understood information. AT: "the olives that stay on the branches are for foreigners, orphans, and widows to pick and take with them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: it will be for the foreigner, for the fatherless, or for the widow

contextId.information: "the land that I promised I would give to them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
